elements.title: Turkey's first airplane (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after building Turkey's first airplane (pictured), its builder was sentenced to jail for flying it without a permit?

elements.title: Abraham Lincoln Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Abraham Lincoln Davis cofounded the Southern Christian Leadership Conference with Martin Luther King Jr., serving as his vice president?

elements.title: Communist Party of Lithuania and Belorussia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Communist Party of Lithuania and Belorussia organized partisan units behind the front lines during the Polish–Soviet War?

elements.title: George F. Kosco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George F. Kosco filmed the signing of the Japanese surrender in color?

elements.title: battle of Benfleet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that evidence of the battle of Benfleet was found in the 19th century in the form of charred timbers and human bones?

elements.title: James W. Lugenbeel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James W. Lugenbeel's journal became the only known record of the proceedings of the 1847 Liberian Constitutional Convention?

elements.title: sesame allergy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that because of the increasing prevalence of sesame allergy, the U.S. will join the EU and Canada in 2023 in instituting mandatory food labeling?

elements.title: Mark Littell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that baseball player Mark Littell developed an anatomically correct athletic cup called the "Nutty Buddy"?
